intro: Epithema parvibracteatum, commonly known as the small-bracted epithema, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Epithema parvibracteatum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
